verses.verse: (The Destruction of Israel) (v 4|AMO 9:4; Am 2.14; 3.14; Hab 3.13; Zeph 2.14) I saw the LORD standing beside (Or on) the altar, and he said: Strike the capitals until the thresholds shake and shatter them on the heads of all the people, (Heb all of them) and those who are left I will kill with the sword; not one of them shall flee away, not one of them shall escape.
(Ps 139.8; Jer 51.53; Ob 4) Though they dig into Sheol, from there shall my hand take them; though they climb up to heaven, from there I will bring them down.

(Isa 27.1; Jer 16.16, 17; Am 1.2) Though they hide themselves on the top of Carmel, from there I will search out and take them; and though they hide from my sight at the bottom of the sea, there I will command the serpent, and it shall bite them.

(Lev 26.33; Jer 44.11; Ezek 5.12) And though they go into captivity in front of their enemies, there I will command the sword, and it shall kill them; and I will fix my eyes on them for harm and not for good.
(Am 8.8; Mic 1.4) The Lord, GOD of hosts, he who touches the earth and it melts, and all who live in it mourn, and all of it rises like the Nile and sinks again, like the Nile of Egypt,

(Ps 104.3; Am 4.13; 5.8) who builds his upper chambers in the heavens and founds his vault upon the earth, who calls for the waters of the sea and pours them out upon the surface of the earth— the LORD is his name.

(Isa 43.3; Jer 47.4; Am 1.5; 2.10; 3.1) Are you not like the Cushites to me, O people of Israel? says the LORD. Did I not bring Israel up from the land of Egypt and the Philistines from Caphtor and the Arameans from Kir?

(vv 4, 10|AMO 9:410; Jer 30.11; 44.27; Joel 2.32) The eyes of the Lord GOD are upon the sinful kingdom, and I will destroy it from the face of the earth —except that I will not utterly destroy the house of Jacob, says the LORD.
(Isa 30.28) For I will command and shake the house of Israel among all the nations, as one shakes with a sieve but no pebble shall fall to the ground.
(Am 6.3; 8.14) All the sinners of my people shall die by the sword, who say, “Evil shall not overtake or meet us.”

(The Restoration of David’s Kingdom) (Ps 80.12; Isa 63.11; Jer 46.26; Acts 15.16, 17) On that day I will raise up the booth of David that is fallen and repair its (Gk: Heb their) breaches and raise up its (Gk: Heb his) ruins and rebuild it as in the days of old,
(Isa 11.14; 43.7; Ob 19) in order that they may possess the remnant of Edom and all the nations who are called by my name, says the LORD who does this.

(Lev 26.5; Joel 3.18) The time is surely coming, says the LORD, when the one who plows shall catch up with the one who reaps and the treader of grapes with the one who sows the seed; the mountains shall drip sweet wine, and all the hills shall flow with it.

(Isa 60.4; 61.4; Jer 30.18; Ezek 28.26; 36.35) I will restore the fortunes of my people Israel, and they shall rebuild the ruined cities and inhabit them; they shall plant vineyards and drink their wine, and they shall make gardens and eat their fruit.
(Isa 60.21; Jer 24.6; 31.28; 32.41; Ezek 34.28) I will plant them upon their land, and they shall never again be plucked up out of the land that I have given them, says the LORD your God.
